#â€‹524 â€” September 24, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

What's in an (Alias) Name? â€” Generic alias types are coming to Go 1.24 (expected in February 2025) in line with this proposal, building on both type aliases and generics. A major use case for type aliases is the ability to refactor without breaking compatibility. Robert explains the basics of type aliases and why bringing them to generics required extraÂ work.

Robert Griesemer

Stuck on What to Build? Guided Learning with RealÂ Projects â€” Todo apps are for AI. Build a real-life project and master advanced backend patterns. Code hands-on in your IDE, no videos. Over 800 devs have joined us to create asynchronous event-driven software that solves real problems. Next cohort startsÂ soon.

Three Dots Labs sponsor

Sets in Go: Using Maps and Recommended Packages â€” Go hasnâ€™t got a native data type for sets, but maps can help you implement your own, as well as packages like golang-set. Willem shows usÂ how.

Willem Schots

Go's Singleflight Melts in Your Code, Not in Your DB â€” The last post in a series on concurrency describes singleflight, a non-core package (thatâ€™s maintained by the Go team) that ensures a function is only run once and its result reused by later callers. There are loads of use cases, especially around databaseÂ access.

Phuong Le

IN BRIEF:

  • Giving Go a Go offers up little most Gophers don't already know, but itâ€™s nice to see Go getting some love in Communications of theÂ ACM.

  • It's not only the ACM, WIRED Magazine has picked up on the Go rush too with Attention, Spoiled Software Engineers: Take a Lesson from Googleâ€™s Programming Language.

Developing a Go Bot That Embeds Ichiban Prolog â€” Ichiban Prolog is a Go-powered implementation of the Prolog logic programming language and opens up the power of the language directly within Go apps. Hereâ€™s one specific useÂ case.

Roger Sen

Register Allocation in the Go Compiler â€” Vladimir maintains GCCâ€™s register allocator system and struggled to find docs on how Go does it, so he went diving into Goâ€™s source code. This is deep stuff, but long story short, he likes Goâ€™s approach: â€œthe current Go RA is a well-designed and creativeÂ RA.â€

Vladimir Makarov (Red Hat)

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Revive 1.4: A Faster, Configurable, Flexible Linter for Go â€” A drop-in replacement of golint that aims to provide a little more structure, configurability, and performance. Itâ€™s used by numerous large Go projects and libraries. GitHubÂ repo.

Minko Gechev

Counterfeiter: Generate Self-Contained, Type-Safe Test Doubles â€” More quickly generate fake implementations of an objectâ€™sÂ collaborators.

Max Brunsfeld

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

Rueidis: A Fast Redis Client with Caching and More â€” A Redis client focused on performance, supporting auto-pipelining of non blocking commands, client-side caching implemented the official way, and support for Redisâ€™s many official extensions. Being hosted under Redisâ€™ official GitHub org is also quite theÂ endorsement.

Rueian

caddy-exec: Caddy Module for Running One-Off Commands â€” Caddy is the fantastic Go-powered HTTP(S) server (we love it here) and this extension makes it possible to trigger commands either during startup/shutdown or via aÂ route.

Abiola Ibrahim

go2type: A Go to TypeScript API Client Generator â€” Simple CLI tool that generates types and queries for frontends for GoÂ backends.

dx314

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

ğŸ’° Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can reduce infrastructure costs byÂ 80%.

ğŸ› ï¸ NewDevTools is a simple, daily update of new developer tools and services.

  • ğŸ‘€ GoCV 0.38.0 â€“ Bindings for the OpenCV computer vision library.

  • MongoDB Go Driver 1.17 â€“ The official Go driver forÂ MongoDB adds support for client authentication using OpenIDÂ Connect.

  • Buf 1.42 â€“ CLI tool for working with ProtocolÂ Buffers. A big update introducing the ability to author custom lint and breaking change rules added withÂ plugins.

  • automaxprocs 1.6 â€“ Automatically set GOMAXPROCS to match Linux container CPU quota.

  • River 0.12 â€“ Fast and reliable Postgres-powered background jobs forÂ Go.

  • Goyave 5.3 â€“ Enterprise REST APIÂ framework.

ã€

#â€‹525 â€” October 1, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

Prep: Compile-Time Function Evaluation for Go â€” â€œBy using prep.Comptime, you can evaluate functions at build time, replacing them with their computed results. Just like comptime from Zig. Except itâ€™s not.â€ It admits itâ€™s â€œpure blasphemyâ€, but you canâ€™t deny itâ€™s an interesting idea, though it has limitations and toolexec was not intended to support arbtirary source rewriting.

Mark / pijng

Some Go Web Dev Notes â€” Weâ€™re always fans of Juliaâ€™s earnest and helpful but no-nonsense posts and this quick grab bag of thoughts, tips and observations is another goodÂ one. She always opens our eyes to somethingÂ new.

Julia Evans

Reduce Your Data Streaming and Kafka Costs by 80+% â€” Learn how WarpStream's zero disk, stateless architecture and BYOC model not only reduce Kafka costs by 80% or more, but makes data streaming easier and more secure. Sign up for a free WarpStream account and get $400 in credits that neverÂ expire.

WarpStream sponsor

ğŸ“‰Â A Guide to the Go Garbage Collector â€” Not a new page â€“ it dates back to Go 1.19 â€“ but one Iâ€™d somehow not encountered before and acts as a living document explaining how Goâ€™s garbage collection system works, complete with helpful interactiveÂ diagrams.

Go Documentation

Joining Errors in Go â€” A helpful look at two approaches: using multiple %ws, and errors.Join (as introduced in GoÂ 1.20).

Paschalis Tsilias

Distributed Metrics in PHP with Go and Gob â€” Gob is a Go package for efficiently encoding and decoding values between GoÂ apps.

Maurits van der Schee

ğŸ“„ Writing Raw SQL Easier with pgx and sqlc in Go remvn

ğŸ“„ 6 Tips for Using Strings in Go â€“ Certainly a goldenÂ oldie. Jon Calhoun

ğŸ“„ Using a Separate Go Module for Your tools.go Jamie Tanna

ğŸ“„ Interfaces in Go â€“ A simpleÂ primer/reminder. Matt Boyle

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Modview: Go Project Dependency Graph Visualizer â€” A simple way to visualize dependencies in Go projects in a clean, graphicalÂ way.

TuÄŸrul Bayrak

htmgo: Build Simple, Scalable Systems with Go and htmx â€” Itâ€™s a brand new â€˜alphaâ€™ project, but provides an interesting way to combine the simplicity of both Go and htmx to quickly build interactiveÂ webapps.

maddalax

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

â“Did you know you can build Fine-Grained Authorization with Go and Open Source? SpiceDB is the most scalable, consistent permissions system inspired by Google Zanzibar.

ğŸª Hookdeck: A serverless queue to reliably send, receive, transform, filter, and route events across your event-driven apps.

Ebitengine v2.8.0: The Go 2D Game Engine â€” Long one of our favorite Go ecosystem projects, Ebitengine takes another gentle step forward with support for 32 bit float format audio and shader customizationÂ improvements.

Hajime Hoshi

gqlgen: A go generate-Based GraphQL Server Library â€” Check out the getting started guide for a feel for the project. GitHubÂ repo.

99designs

Gowitness: A Web Screenshot Utility using Chrome Headless â€” A website screenshot utility written in Go, that uses Chrome Headless to generate screenshots of web interfaces using the commandÂ line.

SensePost

Olric: Distributed Cache and Key/Value Store â€” It can be used both as an embedded Go library and as a language-independentÂ service.

Burak Sezer

anthropic-claude-golang-sdk: Go Library for Anthropic's ClaudeÂ API â€” Send structured messages and handle responses from Anthropicâ€™s conversational AI models within GoÂ apps.

AI Trailblazer

  • Sloc Cloc and Code (scc) 3.4 â€“ Fast and accurate code counter with complexity calculations and COCOMOÂ calculations.

  • dae 0.7.4 â€“ High-perf transparent proxy based onÂ eBPF.

  • Buf 1.43 â€“ CLI tool for working with ProtocolÂ Buffers.

  • Git Town 16.3 â€“ Git branch managementÂ tool.

  • GoBGP 3.30 â€“ BGP implementation inÂ Go.

ğŸ And one extra for fun..

bed: A Binary/Hex Editor Written in Go â€” A Go-powered binary editor with a Vim-like user interface that runs in terminals, is portable, fast and has a window splittingÂ feature.

Itchyny

#â€‹523 â€” September 17, 2024

UnsubÂ Â |Â Â WebÂ Version

Go Weekly

Building LLM-Powered Applications in Go â€” The post describes some different approaches to creating a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) server with different toolsets: Gemini + Weaviate, LangChain, and Genkit. Goâ€™s natural strengths seem to play well in the modern LLM/RAGÂ arena.

Eli Bendersky

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2BÂ SaaS â€” WorkOS is a modern identity platform for B2B SaaS, offering flexible and easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes instead of months. It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, andÂ Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Notes on Running Go in the Browser with WebAssembly â€” Eli explains the basics of calling Go from JavaScript, manipulating the DOM, using TinyGo to reduce the size of the resulting WASM binary, and running things concurrently using WebÂ Workers.

Eli Bendersky

IN BRIEF:

  • There's less than a week to fill out the latest Go community survey.

  • The RedMonk developer analyst firm has put out a Q3 2024 ranking of programming languages with Go at 12thÂ place. Ahead of Rust, atÂ least!

  • TamaGo is a framework for running Go apps on bare metal ARM/RISC-VÂ SoCs.

  • The Go Time podcast's latest episode â–¶ï¸ digs into home automationÂ withÂ Go.

  • A look at changes to channel-based timers in Go 1.23.

Using Go Instead of Bash for Scripts â€” Using Go to replace your scripts means only having to write the script once for all your platforms and not having to relearn OS-specific scripting languages. Itâ€™s more code, but that could be a small price toÂ pay.

Krzysztof Kowalczyk

Cryptography in Go: AES Encryption â€” The last of a three-part excerpt from Johnâ€™s book on Go and cryptography. Youâ€™re challenged with a couple of enciphering/deciphering problems using AES in Go, complete with Johnâ€™s answers andÂ explanations.

John Arundel

Don't Pretty Print Your API's JSON Response Body â€” In other words, avoid spending time and resources doing something users can do on theirÂ own.

Jamie Tanna

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

ğŸš€ The first GoLand 2024.3 EAP build is out! Boost your productivity for free with the newest IDE features and improvedÂ performance.

Dragonfly (25k GitHub stars) is a modern Redis replacement. Organizations that switch to Dragonfly can see 25X performanceÂ improvements.

ğŸ“„ How to Implement Server-Sent Events in Go â€“ Server-Sent Events (SSE) is a Web technology for pushing updates from a server to a client withoutÂ WebSockets. Alex Pliutau

ğŸ“„ Transparent Proxy Implementation using eBPF and Go Teodor J. Podobnik

ğŸ“„ Dockerizing a Go API with MySQL and Docker Compose Support Pradumna Saraf

ğŸ“„ A GitHub Trick to Find the Commit That Deleted a File Raymond Chen

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

The TinyGo Playground (Now With More Resources) â€” TinyGoâ€™s playground lets you write code with simulated hardware (like LEDs, etc.) in your browser and now has double the CPU and RAM for your testingÂ pleasure. It can now also show power consumption estimates for yourÂ code.

TinyGo Project

Script 0.23: Make It Easier to Write Shell-like Scripts in Go â€” Makes tasks like reading files, counting lines, making simple HTTP requests, and running subprocesses easier with an array of fluent chainable functions to make using Go in a scripting context a happierÂ experience.

John Arundel

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

Maelstrom: A Fast, Contained Test Runner for Multiple Languages â€” Currently supporting Go, Rust, and Python, this suite of tools runs tests in isolated micro-containers and claims to â€˜just workâ€™ with your existing tests. Those tests can then run on your local machine or across an entire cluster. GitHubÂ repo.

Maelstrom

PG Back Web 0.3: A Postgres Backup System with Web Interface â€” A Go-powered app for bringing a bit more of a friendly user interface to Postgres backups, as well as scheduled backups, backup monitoring, andÂ webhooks.

Luis Eduardo

FAIR: A Go Library for Serving Resources 'Fairly' â€” Designed to ensure fairness in resource-constrained environments by distributing said resources evenly across multipleÂ clients.

Mihir Sathe

Go Weekly

Share Your Feedback in the Latest Go Developer Survey â€” Itâ€™s your latest chance to influence the direction of Go! The core team really pays attention to the results and is looking for insights into the challenges you have and improvements you want. Certainly worth a few minutes of yourÂ time.

Alice Merrick and the Go Team

Telemetry in Go 1.23 and Beyond â€” In early 2023, Russ Cox introduced the idea of â€˜transparent telemetryâ€™ for Go. Some folks responded poorly to the idea of it being on by default so it became opt-in and was included in Go 1.23. Here, Robert explains how useful such telemetry can be, if youâ€™re tempted to enableÂ it.

Robert Findley

The Frontend Masters Knowledge Quest Sale Is Going on All Week! â€” The Frontend Masters Knowledge Quest sale is now on! There's four new learning paths (including JS performance and code architecture) with more epic courses on the way throughout 2024 andÂ beyond.

Frontend Masters sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Go 1.23.1 and 1.22.7 were released, including three security fixes.

  • Julia Evans explains why she loves Go, noting that she'd "rather have a very simple tool that's less powerful in some ways but that I know will work."

How Go Tests go test (And You Can Too!) â€” Testing is all well and good, but who tests the tester? Itâ€™s actually quite the tale, and Rotem demonstrates how you can adopt the same approach for your own CLIÂ tools.

Rotem Tamir (Atlas)

Alex Ellis (OpenFaaS)

Statically and Dynamically Linked Go Binaries â€” A quick look at Goâ€™s linking mechanisms, contrasting the differences in approach between static and dynamic dependencies and internal vs externalÂ linkers.

Alex Pliutau

Don't defer Close() on Writable Files â€” This post dates from 2017 and there are ways to improve this now, but it provoked an interesting discussion on Hacker News today.

Joe Shaw

Streamline Your Product Delivery with monday dev â€” From ideation to launch, monday dev makes product delivery faster and simpler, all in oneÂ place.

monday dev sponsor

Masterminds
